intro: Echites glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered echites, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense heads, often displaying a range of colors from yellow to orange. Echites glomeratus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
